div.l: Tille that the thred cok began to synge
Aleyn wax wery in the dawnynge
For he had swonke al the longe nyght
And seide fare welle my feire swete wight
The day is come I may no lenger bide
Yett eủermore where so I goo or ride
I am thyn owne clerke sa haue I hele
Nowe dere lēmman quod she go farewelle
But or thou go o thynge I wille the telle
When thou wendiste homeward by the melle
Right at the entre of the dore behynde
Thou shalt a cake of halfe aboyshel fynde
That was made of thyn owne mele
Whiche that I halpe my fadir for to stele
And good lēmman god the saue and kepe
And wᵗith that worde almost she gan to wepe
Alayne vp riste and thought or that it dawe
I wille go crepe yn be my felowe
And fonde the cradille wᵗith his hond anone
Be god thought he alle wronge haue I gone
My hed is toty of my swynke to nyght
That maketh me that I go not aright
I wote welle by the cradille I haue mysgo
Here lieth the myller and his wiff also
And forth he goth a twanty deville wey
In to the bed there the myller lay
He wende haue crepen yn by his felow Iohn
And by the myller yn he crepe anon
And caught hym by the necke ⁊and softe spake
He seide thou swynes hede a wake
For cristes soule and here anoble game
For that lorde that called is seynt Iame
As I haue thryes in this short nyght
